newsitem.title: USA: RESEARCH ALERT - Sadia still a hold.
newsitem.headline: RESEARCH ALERT - Sadia still a hold.

text.p: -- Credit Lyonnais Securities said it was maintaining its hold recommendation for Brazilian meat producer Sadia Concordia's preferred share, but lowering its 1996 and 1997 earnings forecasts for the firm.
-- "We are revising downward our 1996 estimates for Sadia due to weaker than expected domestic pricing, higher soy prices and poorer than expected operating performance," the bank said in a report.
-- Its net earnings projection for this year was lowered to 24.9 million reais, while its 1997 forecast was reduced to 37.9 million reais and its 1998 projection was cut to 55.0 million reais.

-- The reduction in projections for the next two years is based on changes in macroeconomic forecasts, which point to slower growth and lower inflation and higher than previously expected operating expenses, it added.
-- "Sadia benefits from market leadership in processed and frozen meat products, underpinned by the strongest network in the Brazilian meats sector," Credit said.
-- Sadia's preferred was ended flat at 0.62 reais on Wednesday on the Sao Paulo bourse.
